list_definition.definition: a person who takes part in the sport of wrestling

list_ex_of_english: The wrestler who wins the most matches over the fifteen days wins the tournament championship ("ysh") for his division.
One cannot raise gladiators, all-in wrestlers, or people on the kind of eggs sold in the shops today.
Married with four children, he makes his living by selling vegetables; he stopped his training as a wrestler for economic reasons.
Afterwards the selection of opponents takes into account a wrestler's prior performance.
For example a wrestler using an illegal technique (or "kinjite") automatically loses, as does one whose "mawashi" (or belt) becomes completely undone.
Which wrestler was it that the group of tourists photographed?
Some of them have as many muscles as all-in wrestlers.
Chain wrestling competitions differ from the traditional sport in that a substantial chain links the two wrestlers together.
